did.unittitle: Hornbooks
did.abstract: The collection consists of a group of 28 hornbooks. Also included are two auction catalogs for sales where some of the hornbooks were sold and a description of a hornbook in brass from dealer Patrick King's list no. 11, 1986.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Hornbooks were once common objects used to teach children the alphabet and reading-readiness skills.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a group of 28 hornbooks, most of which are from the library of Elisabeth Ball. Also included are two auction catalogs for sales where some of the hornbooks were sold and a description of a hornbook in brass from dealer Patrick King's list no. 11, 1986.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Seven of the hornbooks are described and illustrated in Tuer's History of the hornbook (London: Leadenhall Press, 1897), also located at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana. References to this work in the descriptions are cited as Tuer and page number.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Hornbooks, Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Items 1-27 and 29-30 from the library of Elisabeth Ball. These had belonged to the collector C.T. Owen and some had also belonged to A.W. Tuer.

Arms of a previous owner engraved at base. Engraved line border. Hole in handle for suspension. In brown leather case.

Hole in handle for suspension. In brown leather case.

did.unittitle: Ivory. 16 cm. x 20.6 cm.
did.physdesc: Black capital alphabet engraved on front. Engraved on back: "And/Lord. Lady. Mr. Mrs./Miss. Today. Tomorrow./Yesterday. Read./Very well. Bateman./Fire. Dogs. Chaise. Walk./Ride. Glass. Rain. Dry." This hornbook said to have been used to teach the children of the Duke of Marlborough. "Bateman" said to have been the name of the family's favorite nurse.
Handle cracked. In brown leather case.

Letters and fleurs-de-lis burnt into wood with binder's brass type. "Joseph Howell 1744" burnt into handle. Name repeated on back. Four lines border hornbook.
Top edge carved for decoration. Hole in handle for suspension.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials

No. 36 in Grafton and Hurcombs auction catalogs (see items 29 and 30).

Horn held by four latten strips and eight nails. Half of one latten strip missing. Ornamental border covered by latten strips. In brown leather case.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials

Printed decoration borders sheet. Horn held by four latten strips and eight nails. Nail ends visible through back of wood. In brown leather case.

Four wide strips of brass fastened by ten iron nails. A crown and "W.F." carved on back. Handle has a hole for suspension.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials

did.unittitle: Cardboard and paper. 5.8 cm. X 9.5 cm.
did.physdesc: Printed lesson sheet consists of small alphabet with Long "s," and capital alphabet, surrounded by ornamental border.

Varnish over lesson sheet has worn away in patches. Card covered by Dutch floral paper. (Handle defaced by piece of paper glued to it which gives a reference to Tuer and is marked by a "22" in blue pencil.)

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See Tuer, p. 350, for illustration and description.
No. 21 in Grafton and Hurcombs auction catalogs (see items 29 and 30).

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Andrew W. Tuer, who owned this hornbook, dates it from the opening years of the nineteenth century.

did.unittitle: Silver, ivory, nails. 6.3 cm. x 10 cm.
did.physdesc: Silver plate, set in ivory frame, engraved with capital and small alphabets separated by a wavy line. Four silversmith's marks at top of silver plate. Front and back of ivory frame held by fourteen rivets. Engraved griffin decorates bottom of the frame and handle. Two engraved lines border the ivory frame. Hole in handle for suspension. Crack at top of ivory frame. In brown leather case.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: No. 10 in Grafton and Hurcombs auction catalogs (see items 29 and 30).

did.unittitle: Silver, wood, paper, horn. 5.9 cm. x 11.1 cm.
did.physdesc: Lesson sheet, printed in Black letter, consists of small alphabet preceded by a cross and a capital A; followed by vowels, capital letters, syllabarium, invocation, and Lord's Prayer. Text uses long "s." Silver frame with scalloped edge holds lesson sheet and horn, supported by thin piece of wood. Back of frame elaborately engraved with bird perched on a branch surrounded by foliage. The handle, which has been soldered to the frame, has an inverted tulip and and line border engraved on each side.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: This hornbook resembles one illustrated and described in Tuer, p. 102-103.
Date from Grafton and Hurcombs auction catalogs (see items 29 and 30) where it is no. 23.

did.unittitle: Brass. 6.5 cm. x 14.4 cm.
did.physdesc: Raised capital alphabet on front. On back is carved "St. Paul's Infant School A.D. 1729." Handle at top with hole for suspension.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials

See also No. 40 in Patrick King's list no. 11, 1986 (item 31 of this list).

did.unittitle: Brass. 6.4 cm. x 14.1 cm.
did.physdesc: Raised capital alphabet on front. On back is carved "St. Mary's School Shrewsbury." Handle at top with hole for suspension. In brown leather case.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: No. 38 in Grafton and Hurcombs auction catalogs (see items 29 and 30).

did.unittitle: Wood and paper. 5.6 cm. x 10.3 cm.
did.physdesc: Printed lesson sheet consists of small alphabet preceded by an X and a capital A; followed by capital alphabet, syllabarium, and Lord's Prayer. Ornamental border. Underneath lower border is printed "Printed and sold by Howard and Evans, /42, Long-lane, Smithfield, London." Front is varnished. Lesson sheet attached to wood, which has been covered with Dutch floral paper.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See Tuer, p. 350-351, for illustration and description.
No. 42 in Grafton and Hurcombs auction catalogs (see items 29 and 30).

custodhist.head: Custodial History

did.unittitle: Paper and horn. 8 cm. x 13.5 cm.
did.physdesc: Original hornbook consisted of a piece of printed paper, which was later mounted on a thick slab of horn. Printed lesson sheet, entitled "THE CHILD'S GUIDE TO HIS LETTERS," consists of small alphabet, capital alphabet, italic small alphabet, vowels, syllabarium, invocation, and Lord's Prayer. Text uses long "s." A cross appears underneath printers' names on handle and miniature crosses appear in breaks of the border. Decorative border. Imprint reads: "Glasgow:/Printed and sold by/J. & M. Robert- son,/ MDCCLXXXIV."

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials

No. 43 in Grafton and Hurcombs auction catalogs (see items 29 and 30).

custodhist.head: Custodial History

did.unittitle: Wood, horn, leather, nails, paint. 8.2 cm. x 30 cm.
did.physdesc: Carved and painted figure of a woman on back. Colors have faded but appear to have been red and black. On front, empty horn envelope is held by leather strip and nineteen nails.

did.unittitle: Wood, horn, nails, gilt. 11.2 cm. x 26 cm.
did.physdesc: Raised carved figure of a kneeling angel on back. On front, empty horn envelope held by three rounded strips of wood. Strips painted gilt, though very worn. One nail visible.

did.unittitle: Wood, horn, leather, tacks, metal. 8.7 cm. x 18.3 cm.
did.physdesc: On front, empty horn envelope held by leather strip and ten rounded tacks. On back is a simple abacus composed of three rusted thin metal rods, the ends bent and stuck into the wood, and nine wooden balls, four on the top rod, three on middle, two on bottom. Flecks of red and white paint on balls. Piece of brown string tied around handle.

did.unittitle: Wood, horn, nails. 8.5 cm. x 17.3 cm.
did.physdesc: On front, empty horn envelope held by nineteen nails. Horn cracked and chipped.

did.unittitle: Leather, horn, thread. 12 cm. x 20 cm.
did.physdesc: Two pieces of black leather stitched together and open at the top. Center cut out of front piece, forming a frame. Horn stuck between leather pieces. No lesson sheet. On back, figure of a rearing horse stamped in the center.

did.unittitle: Wood, horn, leather, tacks, metal, paint. 14 cm. x 24 cm.
did.physdesc: On front, empty horn envelope held by leather strip and fifteen tacks. Horn cracked at the top. On the back, capital alphabet and numerals painted in red. Red painted line separates each row. Attached vertically to each side is a thin metal rod, ends bent and stuck into top and bottom edges of wood. Five carved beads threaded on each rod. Hole in handle for suspension.

did.unittitle: Ivory. 4.8 cm. x 10 cm.
did.physdesc: Capital alphabet engraved on front; small alphabet with long "s" on back. Letters colored with black pigment. Floral design on both sides of handle.
